intro: Galenia subcarnosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved galenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Galenia subcarnosa is known for its ability to store water in its leaves, making it well adapted to drought conditions.
